channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: South Korea expresses concern over an immigration raid at Hyundai's Georgia plant
item.description: "The business activities of our investors and the rights of our nationals must not be unjustly infringed," a foreign ministry spokesman said after abo...

item.title: Greetings from Guhagar, India, where newly hatched turtles get some help into the sea
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: Four Democratic senators urge Smithsonian to resist White House attempts to 'bully the institution'
item.description: Sen. Alex Padilla (D-Calif.) and three other Democrats are reminding the Smithsonian's secretary that the institution "is the responsibility of Congre...

item.title: Israel is blasting through Gaza City neighborhoods, but people have nowhere to go
item.description: Israel's military says it has gained "operational control" of 40% of Gaza City and plans to intensify its attacks in a large-scale ground offensive to...

item.title: The U.S. added only 22,000 jobs last month, showing cracks in the labor market
item.description: The U.S. job market showed more signs of weakness Friday, as the Labor Department reported just 22,000 jobs added in August. Revised figures show the ...

item.title: Trump set for first US Open final since 2015
item.description: President Donald Trump will attend the US Open for Sunday's men's singles final - his first visit to the event since 2015.

item.title: Lisbon funicular worker among those killed in crash
item.description: Four employees of a non-profit organisation and a transport worker are among those who died.

item.title: Girls fell behind boys in math during the pandemic. Schools are trying to make up lost ground
item.description: Efforts to close the gender gap in STEM education are gaining momentum after setbacks during the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Trump administration investigates Medicaid spending on immigrants in Democratic states
475 people detained in raid by ICE, other agencies at Hyundai site in Georgia
item.description: The operation targeted one of Georgia's largest and most high-profile manufacturing sites, where Hyundai makes electric vehicles and is building an EV...

item.title: 2025 MTV Video Music Awards to honor Ozzy Osbourne
item.description: The 2025 MTV Video Music Awards will honor Ozzy Osbourne and Mariah Carey as music's biggest stars gather to celebrate. Variety's Jem Aswad has more.

item.title: How teen girls are used as hitwomen in Sweden crime wars
item.description: Some 280 girls aged between 15 and 17 were charged with murder, manslaughter or other violent crimes last year in Sweden.

item.title: What we know about Lisbon's deadly funicular crash
item.description: At least 16 people died after a carriage on the city's famous Glória hillside railway derailed.

item.title: Darth Vader's lightsaber sells at auction for over $3.6 million
item.description: A lightsaber Darth Vader​ used in the Star Wars films "The Empire Strikes Back" and "Return of the Jedi" sold at auction for more than $3.6 million.

item.title: U.S. sending 10 fighter jets to Puerto Rico for operations targeting drug cartels
item.description: The 10 F-35 fighter jets are being deployed to the Caribbean for operations targeting drug cartels, one source said.

item.title: South Koreans detained in ICE raid at Hyundai electric vehicle site in Georgia
item.description: The raid has sparked an angry response from South Korea which called it an unjust infringement of people's rights.

item.title: Aid workers use donkeys to reach remote Sudan landslide site where hundreds feared dead
item.description: Aid workers deliver food and medical supplies to the village cut off by a massive landslide on Sunday.

item.title: Ruth Paine, who opened her Texas home to Lee Harvey Oswald and shooed away conspiracies, dead at 92
